summary:
Mawlid is a special day for Muslims worldwide, marking the birthday of Prophet Muhammad. It is usually celebrated on the 12th day of the Islamic month of Rabi' al-Awwal. While its origins are not ancient, the tradition started with early Islamic scholars responding to insults against the Prophet.

The festival includes reciting religious poetry, feasting, and sometimes extra fasting. It became an official holiday in the Ottoman Empire. Many Muslim countries now recognize Mawlid as a national holiday, and it is widely celebrated by both Sunni and Shia Muslims.
title: Mawlid
